item.title: Acuvue by Johnson & Johnson excels in tests conducted in Japan
item.description: Johnson & Johnson Vision Care’s 1-Day Acuvue Define and Acuvue 2 Define contact lenses were favorably mentioned in a report by Japan’s National Consumer Affairs Center (NCAC) concerning popular colored and limbal ring contact lenses in the Asia Pacific region. The NCAC report, “Safety of Color Contact Lenses,” highlighted that while some manufacturers falsely claimed their lenses had “no pigment on the surface,” 1-Day Acuvue Define and Acuvue 2 Define lenses genuinely lacked surface pigments.

item.title: Access free Wi-Fi at more than 200,000 hotspots throughout Japan
item.description: Source: Wire and Wireless Company. The logo displays the Wi-Fi symbol superimposed on an image of Mt Fuji. Wire and Wireless Company, a Japanese telecommunications provider, is celebrating the second anniversary of its free TRAVEL JAPAN Wi-Fi app. The latest update includes enhanced features and a wider range of free Wi-Fi access points. The app provides travelers with details about nearby stores, restaurants, and attractions, along with numerous discount coupons.

item.title: Dubai World Central is pleased to welcome partnerships between the UAE and Japan through the Japan Trade Centre
item.description: Source: Dubai World Central. Khalid Abdulla, Vice President, Licensing, Registration & Permits Approval, Dubai World Central, Usama Saleh, Vice President, Land Planning and Development, Dubai World Central, with Shogo Ishida, Director, JTC DWC LLC, during the inauguration of the Japan Trade Centre at Dubai World Central in January 2015. The Japan Trade Centre (JTC), a private business-to-business platform promoting Japanese small and medium enterprises (SMEs) internationally, is now operational at Dubai World Central (DWC)’s Business Park.

item.title: Singapore and Japan will work together to promote collaboration and assist in the development of businesses and startups
item.description: Singapore’s Economic Development Board (EDB) and Enterprise Singapore have partnered with the Japan External Trade Organisation (JETRO) to enhance support for startups and businesses in both Singapore and Japan. This agreement was formalized during the ASEAN Economic Ministers’ Meeting 2018. The collaboration aims to create opportunities for startups and businesses by facilitating information exchange and organizing joint initiatives and events. This will strengthen the connection between the innovation ecosystems of Singapore and Japan.

item.title: HTC introduces the 'Butterfly' smartphone in specific Asian markets
item.description: HTC has introduced the HTC J Butterfly HTL23 to the Japanese market through KDDI. This phone, also known as the HTC Butterfly 2, will be available from various carriers, including Chunghwa Telecom in Taiwan, CSL in Hong Kong, and others in South Asia. Source: HTC. The new HTC Butterfly 2 simplifies daily tasks with features like HTC Sense 6, an HTC Duo Camera, and the Motion Launch sensor. Using au carrier aggregation*, the HTC J Butterfly HTL23 offers download speeds up to 150Mbps and supports WiMAX2+.

item.title: The Asia Pacific region is experiencing advancements in IT that are preparing it for the future
item.description: Businesses can be categorized into four groups based on their future readiness: Current Focused, Future Aware, Future Focused, and Future Creators. Future Creators have a significant advantage over their Current Focused counterparts when evaluating key performance indicators. Companies in the Asia Pacific region that are the most future-ready show improvements across eight different business metrics. Source: Dell infographic. The four things that future-ready organisations are more likely to do. Dell recently released findings from a global study conducted by IDC, an analyst firm.

item.title: The Imperial Hotel in Japan is targeting visitors from Southeast Asia
item.description: Source: Imperial Hotel website. The established Imperial Hotel of Japan has launched its inaugural full-service sales office in Southeast Asia to bolster its marketing endeavors within the ASEAN region. Imperial Hotel, Ltd., the company behind the globally acclaimed Imperial Hotel in Tokyo (established in 1890), the recently opened Imperial Hotel in Osaka, and other smaller hotels, along with a mountain resort in the Japan Alps, is expanding its reach.

item.title: Kyoto Yura Hotel Nijo Jo Bettei MGallery is poised to transform into a secret retreat in Kyoto
item.description: Source: Accor. Interior, Kyoto Yura Hotel Nijo Jo Bettei MGallery. Accor has expanded its presence in Japan with the launch of its second MGallery Hotel, the Kyoto Yura Hotel Nijo Jo Bettei MGallery. This Kyoto-based hotel, designed by architect Yukio Hashimoto, centers around a Japanese garden, providing a sophisticated experience of the changing seasons. Hashimoto’s design prioritizes creating a specific atmosphere over focusing solely on materials, resulting in a minimalist and timeless aesthetic.

item.title: The Yokohama Convention & Visitors Bureau extends a warm welcome to Muslim travelers
item.description: Source: Yokohama Convention & Visitors Bureau The Yokohama Convention & Visitors Bureau (YCVB) reports that its specialized Muslim Tourist Information microsite, part of the official Yokohama Visitors’ Guide website, is gaining traction with Muslims in Southeast Asia. Launched in December 2013, the Muslim Tourist Information website highlights tourist attractions, dining, halal shops, and mosques, all recommended by Yokohama’s Muslim residents. A survey of Southeast Asian Muslims revealed that over 90% found the information on restaurants, mosques, and recommended itineraries helpful.

item.title: SilkAir will begin flying between Okinawa and Japan in January 2015
item.description: SilkAir, the regional subsidiary of Singapore Airlines, will launch its inaugural charter flights between Singapore and Okinawa, Japan. Operated in partnership with Okinawa Tourist Service (OTS) and Jumbo Tours Okinawa, these monthly charters will run from September 9, 2014, to January 3, 2015. Utilizing Boeing 737-800 aircraft with both business and economy class seating, these direct flights aim to provide travelers with a convenient option to visit Okinawa. From September to October 2014, flights will depart Singapore Changi Airport Terminal 2 at 10:00 am and arrive at Okinawa Naha Airport at 4:15 pm.

item.title: NOBU presents Harvest in Aomori at InterContinental Hong Kong
item.description: Source: InterContinental Hong Kong. Steamed abalone, sea urchin shijimi dashi jelly, and cured mackerel sashimi with chrysanthemum dressing. NOBU InterContinental Hong Kong presents the fifth installment of its GOURMET TOUR OF JAPAN series – Harvest in Aomori – which runs from September 12th to October 22nd. Executive Chef Sean Mell and Executive Sushi Chef Arakai Kaazunari have crafted special lunch and dinner menus that showcase the fall bounty of Aomori Prefecture, a region in northern Japan’s Tōhoku region.

item.title: This year, Singapore and Korea have emerged as the top universities in Asia
item.description: The National University of Singapore (NUS) has achieved the top ranking in Asia for the first time, according to the QS University Rankings: Asia 2014 published on www.topuniversities.com. These rankings indicate a shift in influence within the region as Singapore and Korea surpass Japan and Hong Kong. Source: QS website. NUS’ accomplishment is paralleled by Nanyang Technological University (NTU), securing 7th place, its highest position yet. Korea’s KAIST advances from 6th to 2nd, while Seoul National University (4th) and Postech (9th) also feature in the top 10.

item.title: Starting from December 21, the FREETEL Prepaid Data SIM for Japan will be available
item.description: Source: Plus One Marketing. Plus One Marketing, a Japanese company known for its FREETEL brand of mobile devices, is launching a prepaid data SIM card specifically for travelers in Japan. Starting December 21, 2015, the FREETEL Prepaid Data SIM will be available for purchase. The SIM card is designed with tourists in mind, allowing unlimited access to popular social media platforms like Facebook, Kakao Talk, WeChat, LINE, and WhatsApp for seven days.

item.title: Singapore welcomes the arrival of Japanese fashion retail concepts
item.description: Source: WMH Group. Kafuku. World Mode Holdings Group (WMH Group) aims to improve the Singapore fashion retail sector by establishing its first international branch, iDA Singapore (iDA’SG). WMH Group is a Japanese fashion retail consultancy firm known for strengthening its clients’ brands. As Japan’s top recruiter for beauty and fashion sales professionals, their Singapore branch will offer expert guidance and support to enhance retail staff skills. “As Japan’s leader in retail job placements, we’ve placed 100,000 retail staff with approximately 1,000 clients, primarily in fashion and luxury.

item.title: Aeromexico introduces an additional flight connecting Shanghai and Mexico City
item.description: Starting July 1st, Aeromexico will expand its service between Shanghai and Mexico City to include a third weekly flight on Sundays. This increase will bring the total number of seats available on the route to over 1,500 each week. The flights, operated by Boeing 777 aircraft, accommodate 277 passengers with 49 business class seats and 228 economy seats. Each Aeromexico flight features personal entertainment systems, increased passenger space, and lie-flat seats in Clase Premier, its business class section.

item.title: IMF provides suggestions for economic policy in Japan
item.description: Japan’s economic growth has decelerated due to subdued private consumption and investment, leading to a loss in inflationary momentum, as per the International Monetary Fund’s (IMF) Executive Board’s assessment following a consultation in late July. Despite favorable financial conditions, declining stock prices and a strengthening yen have contributed to a slight tightening of financial conditions. In response to the weakening domestic and global economic landscape, Japanese authorities have implemented additional monetary and fiscal measures.

item.title: InterContinental Hotels Group plans to open Holiday Inn Osaka Namba by the end of 2016
item.description: Source: IHG. The Holiday Inn Osaka Namba. InterContinental Hotels Group (IHG) and Japan Hotel Real Estate Investment Trust (REIT) Investment Corporation (JHR) are collaborating on the Holiday Inn Osaka Namba, marking the REIT’s first venture with IHG. Scheduled to launch by the end of 2016, the hotel, presently known as Hotel Vista Grande Osaka, will be rebranded as Holiday Inn Osaka Namba. The 314-room hotel, joining the globally recognized Holiday Inn brand, will leverage IHG’s extensive global reservation systems, sales network, and the substantial IHG Rewards Club loyalty program, boasting almost 94 million members.

item.title: The commercial property forecast for Q4 2014 is at its lowest in Hong Kong
item.description: Singapore Marina Bay business district at night. The Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors (RICS) Global Commercial Property Monitor for the fourth quarter of 2014 suggests that while economic indicators show a decline in the Hong Kong economy, growth is expected to rise steadily this year. In Hong Kong, the RICS Occupier Sentiment Index (OSI) decreased slightly from +4 to -3 during the last quarter. The RICS Investment Sentiment Index (ISI) remained negative at -3.

item.title: IIJ Global Solutions Singapore is now providing cloud monitoring services using CA Nimsoft Monitor for small and medium-sized businesses
item.description: IIJ Global Solutions Singapore, a subsidiary of a major Japanese internet and network solutions company, Internet Initiative Japan (IIJ) Group, has incorporated CA Nimsoft Monitor from CA Technologies into its cloud solutions for small and medium-sized businesses. This addition allows IIJ Global Solutions Singapore to offer its clients extensive 24/7 monitoring and reporting services. Using this unified monitoring platform from CA Nimsoft Monitor, users can optimize resources, improve planning and investments, and reduce time spent on troubleshooting.

item.title: Companies that experience data breaches in the Asia Pacific region are unlikely to be forgiven
item.description: New research from SafeNet reveals that data breaches significantly influence customer trust. The global study, including participants from Japan and Australia, found that 65% wouldn’t patronize a business that experienced a financial data breach, compromising credit card details, bank accounts, or login credentials. SafeNet’s Q2 Breach Level Index reported 237 data breaches from April to June 2014, exposing over 175 million records globally. These findings highlight the impact of data breaches on customer loyalty and revenue.

item.title: Walk Japan provides distinctive viewpoints of Japan
item.description: Source: Walk Japan. Viewing Mount Fuji on the Izu Geo Trail. Walk Japan tours provide travelers with the chance to experience Japan’s diverse landscapes throughout the year on a more intimate level. This independent organization offers a fresh perspective on crafting and operating tours within Japan. The company’s deep knowledge and strong local connections, cultivated over many years, guarantee guests genuine experiences everywhere they travel. Japan boasts an abundance of seasonal views.

item.title: JAL's Japan Explorer Pass simplifies travel in Japan
item.description: Japan Airlines (JAL) now offers the Japan Explorer Pass, a convenient and affordable fare option for visitors from outside Japan, as well as Japanese citizens residing abroad, to explore various destinations within the country. Travelers can easily purchase economy class tickets online, adhering to the following guidelines: Domestic flights operated by JAL and JTA (Japan Transocean Air) can be booked up to 72 hours before the scheduled departure, even if the traveler is already in Japan.

item.title: FCM has landed in Japan
item.description: FCM, a travel management company, has partnered with NSF Engagement in Japan. This investment will strengthen FCM’s presence in Asia, supporting current customers and expanding its global reach. Several factors motivated FCM’s expansion in Japan, including a strong business travel market, increasing customer demand in Asia, and the opportunity to offer unique services. The company recognized a need for comprehensive business travel solutions in Japan that are both reliable and user-friendly, based on feedback from FCM customers across various markets.

item.title: Internet access is available during flights on China Eastern Airlines and Skymark Airlines
item.description: Source: Panasonic Avionics. Both China Eastern Airlines (CEA) and Skymark Airlines, Japan’s third-largest airline, are now offering passengers broadband internet access on flights, utilizing technology from Panasonic Avionics. CEA’s first aircraft equipped with this in-flight WiFi, specifically designed to meet China’s requirements, is an Airbus A330. Initially, the plane is dedicated to routes between Shanghai and Beijing, allowing government bodies to assess the service before granting full approval for expansion to other domestic and international routes.

item.title: The Best Western Plus Hotel Nagoya Sakae will be available starting in March 2024
item.description: Source: BWH Hotels. A standard room at the Best Western Plus Hotel Nagoya Sakae, which boasts contemporary rooms with a full range of amenities. Starting March 13, 2024, BWH Hotels (BWH), the international hospitality group that includes WorldHotels, Best Western Hotels & Resorts, and SureStay Hotels, will introduce a newly renovated and rebranded hotel. The Best Western Plus Hotel Nagoya Sakae, formerly the Best Western Nagoya, was one of the city’s most well-liked international mid-scale hotels.

item.title: The KOGEI Future Forward exhibition at Mitsukoshi Nihombashi Main Store showcases the work of 15 artists
item.description: The Mitsukoshi Nihombashi Main Store in Tokyo, Japan, is hosting a contemporary art exhibition, KOGEI Future Forward, from February 15 to 20, 2017. The exhibition showcases the work of 15 Japanese artists, highlighting kogei as a unique form of Japanese fine art. Kogei, meaning “craft,” emerged during the Meiji Period (1868-1912) and has evolved over time to gain recognition as fine art. This exhibition offers a fresh perspective on kogei, curated by Yuji Akimoto, a renowned art professor and museum director.

item.title: The Avex Group introduces high-quality hemp fabric as part of the majotae brand
item.description: Avex Group Holdings, a Japanese entertainment company, has introduced “majotae,” a fabric brand reviving taima-fu, a traditional natural hemp fabric. The photo above features (from left) Shigekazu Takeuchi, Representative Director of Avex Group Holdings; Masato Matsuura, CEO of Avex Group Holdings; Shinichiro Yoshida, natural fabric expert; Genbei Yamaguchi, obi artisan; and Hiroshi Onishi, CEO of Isetan Mitsukoshi Holdings. They were attending the opening reception for the “majotae: The Forgotten Fabric” exhibition at Daikanyama Hillside Forum on October 22, 2014, in Tokyo, Japan.

item.title: In the new application economy, leaders can quickly fall behind and become laggards
item.description: Lim May-Ann, Managing Director of TRPC, presented the findings of the 2016 CA Technologies Asia Pacific & Japan Application Economy Index. Singapore currently holds the top spot in the Asia Pacific and Japan region regarding the application economy. However, it faces a potential decline to fourth place in future potential, according to the inaugural Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ) Application Economy Index (AEI) 2016. This index assesses the readiness of 10 APJ markets to thrive in the digital age.

item.title: The UK Automotive industry continues to export to China as its third-largest destination
item.description: The Society of Motor Manufacturers and Traders (SMMT) recently released data revealing that Britain is exporting more cars than ever. The number of British-built cars shipped globally increased by 10.3%, reaching a new record of 1,354,216 units. This marks the second year in a row that this record has been broken. China, the world’s largest car market, maintained its position as the UK’s third largest trading partner, after the EU and the US.

item.title: SilkAir will provide direct charter flights to Okinawa
item.description: To encourage travel between Singapore and Okinawa, SilkAir, the Okinawa Prefecture government, Japan, and Changi Airport Group are collaborating on seven direct SilkAir charter flights. These flights will operate between June 1st and 25th, 2016, connecting Singapore and Okinawa, Japan’s southernmost prefecture. Travelers can book these full-service flights through Singapore travel agents. SilkAir’s Boeing 737-800 aircraft, featuring Business and Economy class cabins, will service the route. Passengers will enjoy a comprehensive range of full-service offerings, including a baggage allowance of 30kg for Economy and 40kg for Business class, inflight meals, and complimentary inflight entertainment through SilkAir Studio.

item.title: Fujitsu introduces new mobile products in Japan
item.description: Source: Fujitsu. The LIFEBOOK U7310/D. Fujitsu and its subsidiary, Fujitsu Client Computing, have introduced new mobile devices designed to support the changing workstyles of their customers, particularly in remote work environments. The new product lineup consists of nine FUJITSU Notebook LIFEBOOK models, four Fujitsu Tablet ARROWS Tab models (running on Windows), and a Fujitsu Workstation CELSIUS model. These devices are equipped with the latest CPUs and operating systems, with the exception of the CELSIUS model*.

item.title: Cebu Pacific has added Fukuoka to its list of destinations
item.description: Cebu Pacific Air (CEB) initiated flights between Manila and Fukuoka on December 17th, adding a third weekly service to their existing routes in Japan. This marks their fourth destination in Japan, including direct flights from Manila to Osaka, Tokyo (Narita), and Nagoya, as well as flights from Cebu to Tokyo (Narita). Japan is a top destination for travelers from the Philippines. Data from the Japan National Tourism Organization indicates a 44% increase in Filipino arrivals, reaching over 211,000 between January and October 2015, compared to the same period the previous year.

item.title: The Ascott Marunouchi Tokyo has officially opened its doors
item.description: Source: The Ascott Limited. The lobby, Ascott Marunouchi Tokyo. CapitaLand’s serviced residence branch, The Ascott Limited, opened its first high-end serviced residence in Japan on March 30, 2017, under its top brand, Ascott The Residence. The 130-unit Ascott Marunouchi Tokyo is in the desirable Marunouchi-Otemachi district. It’s part of a mixed-use development with offices and close to notable attractions like the Imperial Palace East Gardens and the Ginza area. The residence provides convenient access to Otemachi Station, a major Tokyo subway hub served by five lines, with connections to the Shinkansen bullet train available from nearby Tokyo Station.

item.title: Trunk Calls Soothe Lonely Elephants
item.description: The rapid development of smartphone apps, particularly after the iPhone’s release, has provided solutions for almost every need. But could technology address something as unique as an elephant’s loneliness? Interestingly, a simple cell phone offered a solution for two elephants, Devi and Rahul, at the Okinawa Zoo. When these Bengal elephants were relocated from India, they became despondent and difficult to manage without their familiar trainers, known as mahouts. To address this, the zookeepers devised a heartwarming solution: they used cell phones to allow the elephants to hear the voices of their mahouts back in India.

item.title: FUMI creates authentic Japanese dining experiences for customers
item.description: Source: FUMI Facebook page. FUMI sushi. FUMI, a new Japanese eatery, seeks to share the finest Japanese cuisine in Hong Kong within a space adorned with Japanese art, furnishings, and tableware. They offer a range of dining experiences, from elaborate omakase and kaiseki dinners to individual dishes and set lunch options. Situated in California Tower, FUMI sources the highest quality seasonal ingredients directly from Japan daily. Flown in and delivered straight to their kitchen, these ingredients are often prepared and served within hours of being harvested, guaranteeing freshness in their sushi, sashimi, omakase, and kaiseki preparations, as well as a variety of seasonal menus.

item.title: The Shizuoka guide provides exclusive tips for exploring the city
item.description: Source: Shizuoka City Tourism & City Relations Division. The Shizuoka City Tourism & City Relations Division in Japan has created the “SHIZUOKA GUIDE,” a 52-page guidebook containing coupons. The guide helps inbound tourists enjoy local food and shopping at affordable prices. Information was collected from locals who typically share recommendations through word-of-mouth. The guide features: Lists of popular restaurants ranked by popularity. Locations offering local products like green tea and Mount Fuji souvenirs at reasonable prices.

item.title: The first GYOMU and Megumi-no-Sato stores have opened in Singapore
item.description: Source: G-7 Holdings. Pictures of GYOMU Supermarket and Megumi-no-Sato. G7 International, a subsidiary of the Kobe-based G-7 Holdings responsible for international operations, has launched a GYOMU supermarket and the first overseas Megumi-no-Sato store in Singapore. Both stores will be managed by BB&G-7 Retail, a joint venture between G7 International and a local Singaporean company. GYOMU Japan is a wholesale franchise chain known for offering imported products under its own private label at competitive prices.

item.title: Japan Macro Advisors introduces a new tool to assist in analyzing the Japanese economy
item.description: Source: Japan Macro Advisors. Interactive chart and table. Japan Macro Advisors (JMA) has introduced My Charts, a suite of online analytical tools designed to provide economists and decision-makers with up-to-date insights into the Japanese economy. Based on JMA’s publicly available and continually updated macroeconomic database, My Charts acts as a personalized storage space where users can convert charts into PowerPoint slides. The database currently holds over 500 indicators, including some exclusively available through JMA.

item.title: The Ritz-Carlton is now open in Fukuoka
item.description: Source: The Ritz-Carlton. Facade, The Ritz-Carlton, Fukuoka. The Ritz-Carlton, Fukuoka, the newest addition to Marriott Bonvoy’s 31 hotel brands, has opened its doors on Japan’s Kyushu island. This hotel aims to blend the brand’s signature service and modern design with Fukuoka’s unique blend of history, tradition, culinary richness, and burgeoning startup culture. According to Tina Edmundson, President of Luxury for Marriott International, the opening marks the brand’s seventh hotel in Japan and solidifies its presence in a new and growing market.

item.title: Hong Kong Airlines introduces new flights to Okinawa, Hangzhou, and Ho Chi Minh
item.description: On March 19th, Hong Kong Airlines launched new flights for its Hong Kong-Okinawa and Hong Kong-Hangzhou routes to meet the increasing demand from business and leisure travelers. The airline celebrated the occasion with events at Hong Kong International Airport and both destination airports. Alex Wu, Hong Kong Airlines General Manager of the Hong Kong Sales Office, welcomed passengers on the inaugural Okinawa flight HX678 with model airplanes. At the gate, passengers received certificates acknowledging their support for the new route.

item.title: Explore Japan by walking in February
item.description: Walk Japan offers several winter tours in February 2020: Oita Hot Spring Trail This guided tour explores Oita Prefecture, a region of Japan recognized for its scenic countryside, delicious and diverse cuisine, and welcoming people. Oita is also home to the highest concentration of hot springs, supplied by the largest volume of water. These springs come in various forms, from clear to cloudy, and even pungent or effervescent. Available from February 16-21 at JPY326,000, this tour suits reasonably fit individuals comfortable walking for four hours daily.

item.title: Japanese consumers prefer domestic brands
item.description: Source: YouGov Brandindex. Brandindex rankings for 2016 for Japan. YouGov Brandindex’s 2016 rankings reveal that Japanese brands are the most popular in Japan. Rakuten and Rakuten Card secured the top two spots, followed by clothing retailer Uniqlo in third place. These brands were assessed using BrandIndex’s Buzz score. This score is determined by asking respondents if their exposure to the brand through advertising, news, or word of mouth in the past two weeks was positive or negative.

item.title: Japan Food Town provides unique dining experiences in Singapore
item.description: Japan Food Town: An Authentic Taste of Japan in Singapore [Image of Japan Food Town banner in Wisma Atria with a caption suggesting to take the escalators to the fourth floor] Opening on July 16, 2016, Japan Food Town promises to bring the genuine flavors of Japanese cuisine to Singapore. Located on the 4th level of Isetan Singapore in Wisma Atria mall, this food hall marks the first in a series of planned Japan Food Town locations worldwide.

item.title: Japan and Singapore celebrate 50 years of diplomatic relations with the signing of a new Memorandum of Understanding (MoU)
item.description: Source: Takasaki City. From left: Shinichi Aoshima, President, Takasaki Seinenkeieisya Kyogikai (seated); HE the Ambassador of Japan Kenji Shinoda (standing); Low Yen Ling, Parliamentary Secretary of Singapore Ministry of Trade and Industry and Ministry of Education and Mayor of South West CDC (standing); Douglas Foo, Singapore Manufacturing Federation (seated); Kenji Tomioka, City Mayor, Takasaki (standing). The 50th anniversary of diplomatic relations between Singapore and Japan (SJ50) was commemorated in Singapore on November 18th at the Japan Business Expo - Takasaki Day.

item.title: Belstaff has opened its flagship store in Japan
item.description: Source: Belstaff. The renowned British heritage brand, Belstaff, recently celebrated the grand opening of its flagship store in Tokyo, Japan. Situated within the expansive Ginza Six retail complex, the new store occupies a prime location within this 47,000 square meter shopping destination. This strategic move underscores Belstaff’s growing presence in the Japanese market and its commitment to global retail expansion. Upon its debut, the Tokyo flagship presents a curated selection of Belstaff’s offerings, including the brand’s complete menswear collection and, for the first time in Tokyo, its womenswear line.

item.title: Euromonitor examines consumer opportunities for individuals aged 60 and above
item.description: Source: Euromonitor website. Market research firm Euromonitor International has published a new report on the growing market of older consumers. Though businesses have often overlooked this demographic— individuals aged 60 and above— due to perceptions of low spending, limited income, and resistance to marketing, this group is expanding rapidly. In 2014, the global population aged 60 and over reached 912 million, accounting for 12.6% of the total. By 2030, this segment is projected to increase to 1.

item.title: JR East Group provides a variety of vegan and Muslim-friendly desserts
item.description: Source: JR East via PRN Asia. JR East Group introduces its Plant Based Sweets Series. The grey dish features CAMPANELLA BROWN cookies, while the glass bowl showcases Boule de Rouge cookies. To share its high-quality food with a global audience, the East Japan Railway Company (JR East) has introduced the Plant Based Sweets Series. These sweets are made entirely from plant-based ingredients, sourced from Tokyo. This means they are free of animal products, including bone char-refined sugar, honey, and alcohol.
